headshotImage.caption: Mashrafe Mortaza headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Mashrafe Mortaza headshot

headshotImage.caption: Devon Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Devon Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Cracker! Cleans him up! The fuller length did the trick. Landed on the middle and off stump line, goes on with the angle, Smith is caught at the crease and he tries to work it to on side, the ball evades the waft and crashes into the off stump. Very nice from Mortaza. He had been getting the ball to bend in to the left-hand batsmen so far but this one went on straight and that fooled Smith. He ended up playing a ugly waft across the line.

dismissalComment.html: And Lara falls. He comes down the track and drives powerfully but straight to cover. Lara walks back. This is probably his penultimate knock in the ODIs. There was a gem of whiplash square-drive for six and that is that. He is gone now. West Indies slid further.

dismissalText.commentary: Chris Gayle lbw b Syed Rasel 1 (11b 0x4 0x6 17m) SR: 9.09

dismissalComment.html: Gone! Gayle's horrible run continues. Full in length, it landed on the off stump line and straightened, the bat, again, came outside the line and the ball thudded into the pad in front of off stump. It was hitting off. Gayle has to go and Bangladesh have struck early and how. The openers are back in the hut.

dismissalComment.html: cleaned him up with a yorker. Mortaza, after a fine resistance, falls. Full, on the middle stump line, and hint of late inswing, Mortaza is caught at the crease, his feet in a tangle, the bat comes down in an angle and the ball squeezes past it to crash into the furniture.

dismissalComment.html: caught at square leg, Powell drops it a fraction short, Ashraful goes back and tries to hit over the in field, he's in no position whatsoever to play a pull and the ball hits the high part of the bat before spooning up to Samuels who takes the simplest of catches

headshotImage.caption: Javed Omar player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Javed Omar player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Another one goes down. Again done by the extra bounce.  Omar falls after offering some resistance. Hits the deck short of length, outside the off stump and it holds its line. Omar hops up, stabs at it, bat away from the body, with an open-face of the bat and it flies to the left of first slip where Gayle takes it.

headshotImage.caption: Habibul Bashar player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Habibul Bashar player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: The captain is gone. Smiles all around the West Indies camp. Pace and bounce gets them again. And again. Banged in short, it kicks up around the off stump line, chest-high at a rapid pace, Bashar has no where to go, he hops, takes the bottom-hand off the handel, puts his bat at it as a shield, it collides with the outer edge and flies over Bravo at third slip and he times his jump nicely to grab it.

headshotImage.caption: Corey Collymore player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Corey Collymore player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Aftab Ahmed player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Aftab Ahmed player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Collymore removes Aftab. Lovely seam-position, seam facing the slips and it landed on a length, just outside off stump and shaped away. Aftab hang his bat out at it and it took a bit of outside edge before nestling into the 'keeper's gloves. Collymore can finally celebrate. The ball has not slipped out of the fielder. Lara rushes to congratulate him. Smiles all round.

headshotImage.caption: Shakib Al Hasan headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Shakib Al Hasan headshot

dismissalComment.html: Collymore on fire for Windies. Done in by the extra bounce. Landed on the seam, around the off stump line, kicked up, more than what Saqibul expected as he shaped for a on-the-up square-drive, gets the edge and flies to Ramdin. West Indies are on top here.

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal run out (Bravo) 7 (20b 1x4 0x6 27m) SR: 35

dismissalComment.html: What a way to go. Unbelievably school-boyish dismissal. Length-delivery on the off and middle line, Omar dabbed it close on the off side and both set off for a run. Bravo swooped in from point and suddenly, Tamim froze half-way down the track and tried to turn back. But Javed Omar kept running on and reached the other end first. Meanwhile Bravo picks the ball up, looks up and seems surprised there is no one at the striker's end. He jogs towards it and removes the bails.

dismissalText.commentary: Abdur Razzak c Lara b Bravo 1 (10b 0x4 0x6 9m) SR: 10

dismissalComment.html: Lara takes a catch! he has a huge smile spread across his visage. Finally, something goes well for him. Length-delivery, slanting away from Razzak who tries to withdraw his bat away but is late in doing so and ends up patting it to Lara at second slip. He doesn't make any mistake this time. Bravo celebrates and Lara rushes towards him. All the Windies players converge on the duo. The sun is shining and the weather is sweet for the West Indians. Lara took the catch and only after taking a few steps, released the ball gently towards the square-leg umpire. He was not going to repeat that mistake.

dismissalText.commentary: Syed Rasel b Gayle 2 (13b 0x4 0x6 18m) SR: 15.38

commentTextItems.html: West Indies have won. A Comprehensive victory. They win by 99 runs. Slow in the air, flighted, on the middle and Rasel tries to slog it across the line, misses and the middle stump is pegged back.

commentPostTextItems.html: Bashar comes on to the ground with his team-mates. The Bangladesh fans are happy with their team's effort in the World Cup. Flags are being waved, chants go up as the players from both sides shake hands.

Bangladesh, like some of the other subcontinental sides, were done in by the extra bounce on offer. The horizontal strokes were not visible and the ball collided with the outer edges of the vertical pushes and they went down. One by one. Rahim, who has a very compact technique, moves back and across, rises with the ball, remained unbeaten. Mortaza learnt quickly after being beaten a few times by the bounce and started to cut well. But their efforts were not enough.

Bangladesh have had a pretty good campaign, albeit slighlty schizophrenic. They might have blown hot and cold but when they were hot, boy were they good to watch. They hammered India, walloped South Africa, then no. 1 team, but then they also lost to Ireland. Such has been the inconsistency but they would, as they should, take the positives, learn from the mistakes and move on.

West Indies ... well, finally some joy. But, despite the win, all is not well with them. This has been a disappointing campaign for them. They have one more match left: Against England on Saturday. Post that, they will have to make some tough decisions. We have to wait and watch.
This is Sriram Veera signing off. Join us tomorrow for Australia v New Zealand.

commentTextItems.html: tossed-up, full, backs away to the leg side, tries to slog it over cover, gets a inside-edge to the leg side

commentPreTextItems.html: Rod: "Not a bad W Indies campaign if they beat England. That will give them 5th spot -ranked 8th. Little consolation when you look at the performances however."

tossed up on the middle, paddled away fto short fine leg
from round the stumps, floated outside off, driven to cover

commentPreTextItems.html: Two slips and a very short square-leg in place

commentTextItems.html: yorker-length, outside off stump, jabbed away, with a bit of outside edge, to second slip

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal run out (Bravo) 7 (20b 1x4 0x6 27m) SR: 35

dismissalComment.html: What a way to go. Unbelievably school-boyish dismissal. Length-delivery on the off and middle line, Omar dabbed it close on the off side and both set off for a run. Bravo swooped in from point and suddenly, Tamim froze half-way down the track and tried to turn back. But Javed Omar kept running on and reached the other end first. Meanwhile Bravo picks the ball up, looks up and seems surprised there is no one at the striker's end. He jogs towards it and removes the bails.

dismissalText.commentary: Habibul Bashar c Bravo b Powell 12 (21b 1x4 0x6 29m) SR: 57.14

dismissalComment.html: The captain is gone. Smiles all around the West Indies camp. Pace and bounce gets them again. And again. Banged in short, it kicks up around the off stump line, chest-high at a rapid pace, Bashar has no where to go, he hops, takes the bottom-hand off the handel, puts his bat at it as a shield, it collides with the outer edge and flies over Bravo at third slip and he times his jump nicely to grab it.

dismissalText.commentary: Abdur Razzak c Lara b Bravo 1 (10b 0x4 0x6 9m) SR: 10

dismissalComment.html: Lara takes a catch! he has a huge smile spread across his visage. Finally, something goes well for him. Length-delivery, slanting away from Razzak who tries to withdraw his bat away but is late in doing so and ends up patting it to Lara at second slip. He doesn't make any mistake this time. Bravo celebrates and Lara rushes towards him. All the Windies players converge on the duo. The sun is shining and the weather is sweet for the West Indians. Lara took the catch and only after taking a few steps, released the ball gently towards the square-leg umpire. He was not going to repeat that mistake.

dismissalComment.html: cleaned him up with a yorker. Mortaza, after a fine resistance, falls. Full, on the middle stump line, and hint of late inswing, Mortaza is caught at the crease, his feet in a tangle, the bat comes down in an angle and the ball squeezes past it to crash into the furniture.

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Lara takes a catch! he has a huge smile spread across his visage. Finally, something goes well for him. Length-delivery, slanting away from Razzak who tries to withdraw his bat away but is late in doing so and ends up patting it to Lara at second slip. He doesn't make any mistake this time. Bravo celebrates and Lara rushes towards him. All the Windies players converge on the duo. The sun is shining and the weather is sweet for the West Indians. Lara took the catch and only after taking a few steps, released the ball gently towards the square-leg umpire. He was not going to repeat that mistake.

headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Rafique player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: arm-ball, from round the stumps, does the trick. Full in length, lands outside off stump, Rafique goes back, instead of pressing forward, and the ball comes in with the arm, the bat comes outside the line and he is caught dead plumb in front.

headshotImage.caption: Syed Rasel player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Syed Rasel player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: West Indies have won. A Comprehensive victory. They win by 99 runs. Slow in the air, flighted, on the middle and Rasel tries to slog it across the line, misses and the middle stump is pegged back.

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal run out (Bravo) 7 (20b 1x4 0x6 27m) SR: 35

dismissalComment.html: What a way to go. Unbelievably school-boyish dismissal. Length-delivery on the off and middle line, Omar dabbed it close on the off side and both set off for a run. Bravo swooped in from point and suddenly, Tamim froze half-way down the track and tried to turn back. But Javed Omar kept running on and reached the other end first. Meanwhile Bravo picks the ball up, looks up and seems surprised there is no one at the striker's end. He jogs towards it and removes the bails.

dismissalText.commentary: Aftab Ahmed c †Ramdin b Collymore 6 (8b 0x4 0x6 10m) SR: 75

dismissalComment.html: Collymore removes Aftab. Lovely seam-position, seam facing the slips and it landed on a length, just outside off stump and shaped away. Aftab hang his bat out at it and it took a bit of outside edge before nestling into the 'keeper's gloves. Collymore can finally celebrate. The ball has not slipped out of the fielder. Lara rushes to congratulate him. Smiles all round.

dismissalComment.html: Another one goes down. Again done by the extra bounce.  Omar falls after offering some resistance. Hits the deck short of length, outside the off stump and it holds its line. Omar hops up, stabs at it, bat away from the body, with an open-face of the bat and it flies to the left of first slip where Gayle takes it.

dismissalText.commentary: Habibul Bashar c Bravo b Powell 12 (21b 1x4 0x6 29m) SR: 57.14

dismissalComment.html: The captain is gone. Smiles all around the West Indies camp. Pace and bounce gets them again. And again. Banged in short, it kicks up around the off stump line, chest-high at a rapid pace, Bashar has no where to go, he hops, takes the bottom-hand off the handel, puts his bat at it as a shield, it collides with the outer edge and flies over Bravo at third slip and he times his jump nicely to grab it.

stories.title: Lara looks to the future
stories.subTitle: The legend bids adieu to international cricket
stories.summary:
According to Lara, a press conference wasn't the right forum
to debate whatever had gone wrong behind the scenes, though he did say
that the new captain would need "whole-hearted support from the board and
the selectors.

recentReportStory.title: Windies seal first Super Eights win
recentReportStory.subTitle: Bangladesh v West Indies, Super Eights, Barbados
recentReportStory.summary: This was just the way it was for Bangladesh on an ultimately disappointing day that saw them win the toss, stifle an unmotivated West Indies to 67 for 3 after 25 overs, and then let a gettable target of 231 end in another batting disaster.
recentReportStory.credit: Jamie Alter is editorial assistant of Cricinfo
